required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Investigate the Performance of Cervical Arthroplasty for the Treatment of Cervical Degenerative Disc Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Centre, Prospective, Randomized, Post Marketing Surveillance Study Comparing Cervical Arthroplasty to Anterior Cervical Discectomy and Fusion (ACDF) for the Treatment of Cervical Degenerative Disc Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the performance of the Discover cervical Artificial disc in the treatment of degenerative disc disease in one level of the cervical spine.

detailed_description.textblock: The protocol underwent 3 amendments, the last of which (02APR2009) changed the study design from a randomized to a non-randomized and non-comparative clinical trial. All of the subjects were enrolled under the randomized design with the exception of the last subject. This study is not applicable per FDAA Title VIII, Section 801 due to the final trial design. However, results are submitted to clinicaltrials.gov due to the majority of study data being collected under a randomized (FDAA Title VIII, Section 801 applicable) trial design

clinical_study.why_stopped: study progress and recruitment rate too low

primary_outcome.description: Overall success was a composite endpoint determined by the following clinical outcome measures: 1. Neck Disability Index â‰¥ 15-point improvement from baseline to 12 months post-operative, 2. No new clinically significant permanent abnormalities in neurological function (i.e. motor strength, nerve root tension signs, sensory and reflex signs) from baseline to 12 months post-operative, 3. No subsequent secondary surgical interventions (SSI) at the index level, and 4. No device-related serious events (dSAE) from intra-operative through 12-months post-operative. Please note that these time periods were intended to be from baseline to 24 months post-operative, but since the study was terminated early the 12 month time periods were utilized.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) Neck Pain From Pre-treatment to 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: The visual analogue scale (VAS) pain score asks the subject to place a vertical mark on a horizontal line (that is approximately 10 cm long) with 'No Pain' (score of 0 = 0 cm) listed on the left and 'Very severe pain' (score of 100 = 10 cm) labeled on the right. The subject is instructed to indicate the amount of pain they feel in their neck.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) Left Arm Pain From Pre-treatment to 12 Months.
secondary_outcome.description: The visual analogue scale (VAS) pain score asks the subject to place a vertical mark on a horizontal line (that is approximately 10 cm long) with 'No Pain' (score of 0 = 0 cm) listed on the left and 'Very severe pain' (score of 100 = 10 cm) labeled on the right. The subject is instructed to indicate the amount of pain they feel in their left arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) Right Arm Pain From Pre-treatment to 12 Months.
secondary_outcome.description: The visual analogue scale (VAS) pain score asks the subject to place a vertical mark on a horizontal line (that is approximately 10 cm long) with 'No Pain' (score of 0= 0 cm) listed on the left and 'Very severe pain' (score of 100= 10 cm) labeled on the right. The subject is instructed to indicate the amount of pain they feel in their right arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) Right Shoulder Pain From Pre-treatment to 12 Months.
secondary_outcome.description: The visual analogue scale (VAS) pain score asks the subject to place a vertical mark on a horizontal line (that is approximately 10 cm long) with 'No Pain' (score of 0 = 0 cm) listed on the left and 'Very severe pain' (score of 100 = 10 cm) labeled on the right. The subject is instructed to indicate the amount of pain they feel in their right shoulder.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) Left Shoulder Pain From Pre-treatment to 12 Months.
secondary_outcome.description: The visual analogue scale (VAS) pain score asks the subject to place a vertical mark on a horizontal line (that is approximately 10 cm long) with 'No Pain' (score of 0 = 0 cm) listed on the left and 'Very severe pain' (score of 10 = 10 cm) labeled on the right. The subject is instructed to indicate the amount of pain they feel in their left shoulder.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Mental Component Summary Quality of Life Measure Assessed by Short Form SF-36 From Pre-treatment to 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: The 36-item Short Form Health Survey (SF-36) is a patient reported outcome survey that evaluates functional health and well-being. The survey is converted into 2 summary measures that are scored from 0 to 100 (where 100 indicates the highest level of health) - the Physical Component Score (PCS-36) and Mental Component Score (MCS-36)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Physical Component Summary Quality of Life Measure Assessed by Short Form SF-36 From Pre-treatment to 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: The 36-item Short Form Health Survey (SF-36) is a patient reported outcome survey that evaluates functional health and well-being. The survey is converted into 2 summary measures that are scored from 0 to 100 (where 100 indicates the highest level of health) - the Physical Component Score (PCS-36) and Mental Component Score (MCS-36)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Function Assessed by Neck Disability Index Improvement From Pre-treatment to 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: The neck disability index (NDI) is a validated, disease specific, self-administrated questionnaire for assessing pain intensity and function in patients with neck pain on a scale from 0 to 100. A lower score is a better result (i.e. less severe pain and/or better function). The proportion of patients with an improved score (lower) of 15 points or more was the analysis variable.
The proportion of subjects with unrestricted work status (compared to subjects not working or with restricted work status) is reported at the 12 month follow-up interval.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sagittal Angulation, Also Known as Global Lordosis, Measured Radiographically at 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Sagittal Angulation is a measure of the angle formed between the inferior endplate of the C2 vertebrae and the corresponding inferior endplate of vertebrae C7 of the spine, measured in degrees, from a side (sagittal) view.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjacent Level Degeneration Measured Radiographically at 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Adjacent Level Degeneration is evaluated using a point system that assigns numerical scores to severity of Height Loss, Anterior Osteophytes, and Endplate Sclerosis; and then grades into one of the following five categories: None, Mild, Moderate, Severe, or NA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maintenance of Disc Height Measured Radiographically at 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Maintenance of disc height is measured at the index and adjacent levels to determine the effect of the treatment on restoration or maintenance of the disc height. Initial post-operative disc height is compared with subsequent post-operative visits (i.e. 6 months) to evaluate the maintenance of disc height. The height is measured in millimeters (mm).

secondary_outcome.measure: Foraminal Height Measured Radiographically at 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Foraminal height is the maximum vertical distance, measured in millimeters (mm), between the inferior surface of the superior pedicle and superior surface of the inferior pedicle. These measurements are obtained via magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).

secondary_outcome.measure: Cervical Range of Motion Measured Radiographically at 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Cervical range of motion measures the angle, in degrees, between the inferior endplate of C2 to the inferior endplate of C7 on flexion-extension radiographs.
The proportion of subjects with device related adverse events as reported throughout the duration of the study.

arm_group.description: Anterior Cervical Discectomy and Fusion with Cervical CFRP I/F CAGEÂ® and SLIM LOC(R) Anterior Cervical Plate System with allograft

intervention.description: Cervical CFRP I/F CAGEÂ® and SLIM LOC(R) Anterior Cervical Plate System with allograft

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female subjects, aged between 18 and 65 years inclusive.
- Subjects who are able to give voluntary, written informed consent to participate in this clinical investigation and from whom consent has been obtained.
- Subjects who, in the opinion of the Clinical Investigator, are able to understand this clinical investigation, co-operate with the investigational procedures and are willing to return to the hospital for all the required post-operative follow-ups.
- Objective evidence of cervical disc disease in one vertebral level between C3-C7 defined as one or more of the following:
- Shoulder and/or arm pain in a radicular distribution resulting from herniated disc or bony osteophytes (Consistent w diagnostic imaging including Axial CT, CT Myelogram, MRI and/or plain films)
- Subjects with myeloradiculopathy resulting from mild spinal cord compression and nerve root impingement
- Unresponsive to documented non-surgical management for â‰¥ 6 weeks and/or presents with progressive symptoms of nerve root or spinal cord compression in the face of continued non-surgical management (e.g., physical therapy, medication therapy, corticosteroid injections, etc.)
- Minimum Neck Disability Index score of â‰¥30 % (15/50 points)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who, in the opinion of the Clinical Investigator, have an existing condition that would compromise their participation and follow-up in this clinical investigation.
- Subjects who are pregnant, lactating or wishes to become pregnant within the duration of the study.
- Subjects who are known drug or alcohol abusers or with psychological disorders that could affect follow-up care or treatment outcomes.
- Subjects who have participated in a clinical investigation with an investigational product in the last 30 days.
- Subjects who are currently involved in any injury litigation claims.
- Subjects with significant degeneration at more than one cervical level (e.g. DISH, ankylosing spondylitis, congenital abnormality, rheumatoid arthritis)
- Subjects who have had any prior surgery at the level to be treated (subjects with a prior Laminotomy at the level to be treated may be included in the study)
- Subjects who have marked cervical instability on lateral or flexion/extension x-rays defined as translation â‰¥3mm and/or â‰¥11 degrees of rotational difference to either adjacent level
- Subjects who have presence of systemic infection or infection at the site of surgery
- Subjects who have been diagnosed with malignancy
- Subjects who have been diagnosed with a condition or require postoperative medication(s) that may interfere with bony/soft tissue healing
- Subjects who have been diagnosed with Osteoporosis, Osteopenia, other metabolic bone disease or endocrine disorder known to affect osteogenesis.
- Subjects with pre-existing neurological abnormalities other than deficits produced from the spinal lesion (e.g., MS, Parkinson's, CVA, diabetic neuropathy, peripheral neuropathy).
- Subjects with morbid obesity defined as a BMI of â‰¥40, or more than 100 lbs (45.4kg) over ideal weight.
- Subjects with any known allergy to titanium metal, polyethylene, metal alloy or carbon fibre reinforced polymer
- Subjects who have had prior fusion surgery at any level(s) (C1-T1)
- Subjects with kyphosis >-15 degrees evaluated using the Cobb angle measurement
- Subjects with Significant cervical degenerative disease characterized by bridging anterior osteophytes, significant loss of disc space height (3mm or less), sclerotic facets, large posterior osteophytes, autofusion of other cervical levels, and degenerative retrolisthesis. Spinal diseases such as DISH, ankylosing spondylitis, congenital abnormality, and rheumatoid arthritis, should also be excluded
- Subjects undergoing treatment with a bone growth stimulator, which cannot be discontinued prior to enrollment in the study.
- Significant kyphotic deformity or significant reversal of lordosis.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 5 sites enrolled 60 subjects who were randomized into two treatment groups. Site 12 (17 subjects total) transferred into the Discover IDE study. Site 04 (5 subjects total) did not submit data, which was limited, due to EDC technical difficulties at the site. Therefore 38 subjects are reported in this study.

outcome.title: Overall Patient Success
outcome.description: Overall success was a composite endpoint determined by the following clinical outcome measures: 1. Neck Disability Index â‰¥ 15-point improvement from baseline to 12 months post-operative, 2. No new clinically significant permanent abnormalities in neurological function (i.e. motor strength, nerve root tension signs, sensory and reflex signs) from baseline to 12 months post-operative, 3. No subsequent secondary surgical interventions (SSI) at the index level, and 4. No device-related serious events (dSAE) from intra-operative through 12-months post-operative. Please note that these time periods were intended to be from baseline to 24 months post-operative, but since the study was terminated early the 12 month time periods were utilized.
outcome.population: Overall Patient Success is composed of several outcome measures, some of which require a valid pre-operative and 12-month post-operative score. Due to withdrawals and incomplete or unavailable assessments, 18 subjects in the CTDR and 11 subjects in the ACDF treatment groups were available for the Overall Patient Success calculation.

measure.title: Overall Patient Success
measure.description: Overall success was a composite endpoint determined by the following clinical outcome measures: 1. Neck Disability Index â‰¥ 15-point improvement from baseline to 12 months post-operative, 2. No new clinically significant permanent abnormalities in neurological function (i.e. motor strength, nerve root tension signs, sensory and reflex signs) from baseline to 12 months post-operative, 3. No subsequent secondary surgical interventions (SSI) at the index level, and 4. No device-related serious events (dSAE) from intra-operative through 12-months post-operative. Please note that these time periods were intended to be from baseline to 24 months post-operative, but since the study was terminated early the 12 month time periods were utilized.
measure.population: Overall Patient Success is composed of several outcome measures, some of which require a valid pre-operative and 12-month post-operative score. Due to withdrawals and incomplete or unavailable assessments, 18 subjects in the CTDR and 11 subjects in the ACDF treatment groups were available for the Overall Patient Success calculation.

outcome.title: Change in Mental Component Summary Quality of Life Measure Assessed by Short Form SF-36 From Pre-treatment to 12 Months
outcome.description: The 36-item Short Form Health Survey (SF-36) is a patient reported outcome survey that evaluates functional health and well-being. The survey is converted into 2 summary measures that are scored from 0 to 100 (where 100 indicates the highest level of health) - the Physical Component Score (PCS-36) and Mental Component Score (MCS-36)
outcome.population: Due to withdrawals and incomplete or unavailable assessments, 16 subjects in the CTDR and 10 subjects in the ACDF treatment groups were available for this outcome.

measure.title: Change in Mental Component Summary Quality of Life Measure Assessed by Short Form SF-36 From Pre-treatment to 12 Months

outcome.title: Change in Function Assessed by Neck Disability Index Improvement From Pre-treatment to 12 Months
outcome.description: The neck disability index (NDI) is a validated, disease specific, self-administrated questionnaire for assessing pain intensity and function in patients with neck pain on a scale from 0 to 100. A lower score is a better result (i.e. less severe pain and/or better function). The proportion of patients with an improved score (lower) of 15 points or more was the analysis variable.
outcome.population: Due to withdrawals and incomplete or unavailable assessments, 18 subjects in the CTDR and 11 subjects in the ACDF treatment groups were available for this outcome.

measure.title: Change in Function Assessed by Neck Disability Index Improvement From Pre-treatment to 12 Months
measure.description: The neck disability index (NDI) is a validated, disease specific, self-administrated questionnaire for assessing pain intensity and function in patients with neck pain on a scale from 0 to 100. A lower score is a better result (i.e. less severe pain and/or better function). The proportion of patients with an improved score (lower) of 15 points or more was the analysis variable.
measure.population: Due to withdrawals and incomplete or unavailable assessments, 18 subjects in the CTDR and 11 subjects in the ACDF treatment groups were available for this outcome.

outcome.title: Work Status Assessed at 12 Months
outcome.description: The proportion of subjects with unrestricted work status (compared to subjects not working or with restricted work status) is reported at the 12 month follow-up interval.
outcome.population: Due to withdrawals and incomplete or unavailable assessments, 18 subjects in the CTDR and 12 subjects in the ACDF treatment groups were available for this outcome.

measure.title: Work Status Assessed at 12 Months
measure.description: The proportion of subjects with unrestricted work status (compared to subjects not working or with restricted work status) is reported at the 12 month follow-up interval.
measure.population: Due to withdrawals and incomplete or unavailable assessments, 18 subjects in the CTDR and 12 subjects in the ACDF treatment groups were available for this outcome.

outcome.title: Sagittal Angulation, Also Known as Global Lordosis, Measured Radiographically at 6 Months
outcome.description: Sagittal Angulation is a measure of the angle formed between the inferior endplate of the C2 vertebrae and the corresponding inferior endplate of vertebrae C7 of the spine, measured in degrees, from a side (sagittal) view.
outcome.population: Only 2 subjects in the Cervical Total Disc Replacement (cTDR) and 1 subject in the ACDF treatment groups were available for this outcome measure. There were 2 ACDF subjects at this endpoint, however one subject was missing the flexion extension rotation radiographic view therefore could not be included in the analysis.

measure.title: Sagittal Angulation, Also Known as Global Lordosis, Measured Radiographically at 6 Months
measure.description: Sagittal Angulation is a measure of the angle formed between the inferior endplate of the C2 vertebrae and the corresponding inferior endplate of vertebrae C7 of the spine, measured in degrees, from a side (sagittal) view.
measure.population: Only 2 subjects in the Cervical Total Disc Replacement (cTDR) and 1 subject in the ACDF treatment groups were available for this outcome measure. There were 2 ACDF subjects at this endpoint, however one subject was missing the flexion extension rotation radiographic view therefore could not be included in the analysis.

measurement_list.measurement: One ACDF subject was missing the flexion extension rotation radiographic view therefore could not be included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Adjacent Level Degeneration Measured Radiographically at 24 Months
outcome.description: Adjacent Level Degeneration is evaluated using a point system that assigns numerical scores to severity of Height Loss, Anterior Osteophytes, and Endplate Sclerosis; and then grades into one of the following five categories: None, Mild, Moderate, Severe, or NA.
outcome.population: Study was terminated prior to 24 months therefore there are no results for this endpoint.

measure.title: Adjacent Level Degeneration Measured Radiographically at 24 Months
measure.description: Adjacent Level Degeneration is evaluated using a point system that assigns numerical scores to severity of Height Loss, Anterior Osteophytes, and Endplate Sclerosis; and then grades into one of the following five categories: None, Mild, Moderate, Severe, or NA.
measure.population: Study was terminated prior to 24 months therefore there are no results for this endpoint.

outcome.title: Maintenance of Disc Height Measured Radiographically at 6 Months
outcome.description: Maintenance of disc height is measured at the index and adjacent levels to determine the effect of the treatment on restoration or maintenance of the disc height. Initial post-operative disc height is compared with subsequent post-operative visits (i.e. 6 months) to evaluate the maintenance of disc height. The height is measured in millimeters (mm).
outcome.population: Only 2 subjects in the cTDR and 1 subject in the ACDF treatment groups were available for this outcome measure. There were 2 ACDF subjects at this endpoint, however one subject was missing the flexion extension rotation radiographic view therefore could not be included in the analysis.

There were 2 ACDF subjects at this endpoint, however one subject was missing the flexion extension rotation radiographic view therefore could not be included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Foraminal Height Measured Radiographically at 24 Months
outcome.description: Foraminal height is the maximum vertical distance, measured in millimeters (mm), between the inferior surface of the superior pedicle and superior surface of the inferior pedicle. These measurements are obtained via magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).
outcome.population: The study was terminated prior to 24 months therefore there are no results for this endpoint.

measure.title: Foraminal Height Measured Radiographically at 24 Months
measure.description: Foraminal height is the maximum vertical distance, measured in millimeters (mm), between the inferior surface of the superior pedicle and superior surface of the inferior pedicle. These measurements are obtained via magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).
measure.population: The study was terminated prior to 24 months therefore there are no results for this endpoint.

outcome.title: Cervical Range of Motion Measured Radiographically at 6 Months
outcome.description: Cervical range of motion measures the angle, in degrees, between the inferior endplate of C2 to the inferior endplate of C7 on flexion-extension radiographs.
outcome.population: Only 2 subjects in the cTDR and 2 subjects in the ACDF treatment groups were available for this outcome measure.

measure.population: Only 2 subjects in the cTDR and 2 subjects in the ACDF treatment groups were available for this outcome measure.

outcome.title: Device Related Adverse Events
outcome.description: The proportion of subjects with device related adverse events as reported throughout the duration of the study.

measure.title: Device Related Adverse Events
measure.description: The proportion of subjects with device related adverse events as reported throughout the duration of the study.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse Events were collected from the intra-operatively to 24 months post-operative timepoint (the patient with the longest follow-up for potential AE reporting was 24 months).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Clinical Investigators may freely present or publish results of the Clinical Investigation in a manner which fairly sets forth the conclusions reached by the Clinical Investigators, but only after DePuy has been given the opportunity of reviewing the proposed presentation or publication at least 30 days prior to the intended submission, presentation, or publication date.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Study was terminated early therefore the latest clinical data available is at the 12 month post-operative timepoint and the latest radiographic data available is at the 6 month post-operative timepoint.
